item.title: Arantza add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description:
"The Road Not Taken
Two roads diverged in a yellow wood, And sorry I could not travel both And be one traveler, long I stood And looked down one as far as I could To where it bent in the undergrowth;
Then took the other, as just as fair, And having perhaps the better claim, Because it was grassy and wanted wear; Though as for that the passing there Had worn them really about the same,
And both that morning equally lay In leaves no step had trodden black. Oh, I kept the first for another day! Yet knowing how way leads on to way, I doubted if I should ever come back.
I shall be telling this with a sigh Somewhere ages and ages hence: Two roads diverged in a wood, and I— I took the one less traveled by, And that has made all the difference." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Arantza add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Love all, trust a few, do wrong to none." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Arantza add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "O Romeo, Romeo, wherefore art thou Romeo? Deny thy father refuse thy name, thou art thyself thou not a montegue, what is montegue? tis nor hand nor foot nor any other part belonging to a man What is in a name? That which we call a rose by any other name would smell as sweet, So Romeo would were he not Romeo called retain such dear perfection to which he owes without that title, Romeo, Doth thy name! And for that name which is no part of thee, take all thyself." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Arantza add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "This above all: to thine own self be true, And it must follow, as the night the day, Thou canst not then be false to any man." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Arantza add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "It is not in the stars to hold our destiny but in ourselves." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Arantza add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "To live is the rarest thing in the world. Most people exist, that is all." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Arantza add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Who, being loved, is poor?" -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Arantza add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Indeed I have always been of the opinion that hard work is simply the refuge of people who have nothing to do." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Arantza add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "In this world there are only two tragedies. One is not getting what one wants, and the other is getting it. (Mr. Dumby, Act III)" -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Arantza add a quote by Theodore Roosevelt
item.description: "Do what you can, with what you have, where you are." -- Theodore Roosevelt

item.title: Arantza add a quote by Bill Keane
item.description: "Yesterday is history, tomorrow is a mystery, today is a gift of God, which is why we call it the present." -- Bill Keane

item.title: Arantza add a quote by Theodore Roosevelt
item.description: "The only man who never makes mistakes is the man who never does anything." -- Theodore Roosevelt

item.title: Arantza add a quote by Theodore Roosevelt
item.description: "Believe you can and you're halfway there." -- Theodore Roosevelt

item.title: Arantza add a quote by Franklin D. Roosevelt
item.description: "The only thing we have to fear is fear itself." -- Franklin D. Roosevelt

item.title: Arantza add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "No one can make you feel inferior without your consent." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Arantza add a quote by Theodore Roosevelt
item.description: "It is hard to fail, but it is worse never to have tried to succeed." -- Theodore Roosevelt

item.title: Arantza add a quote by Allen Saunders
item.description: "Life is what happens to you while you're busy making other plans." -- Allen Saunders

item.title: Arantza add a quote by John Lennon
item.description: "You may say I'm a dreamer, but I'm not the only one. I hope someday you'll join us. And the world will live as one." -- John Lennon

item.title: Arantza add a quote by Marthe Troly-Curtin
item.description: "Time you enjoy wasting is not wasted time." -- Marthe Troly-Curtin

item.title: Arantza add a quote by Kahlil Gibran
item.description: "Beauty is not in the face; beauty is a light in the heart." -- Kahlil Gibran

item.title: Arantza add a quote by Kahlil Gibran
item.description: "Some of you say, “Joy is greater than sorrow,” and others say, “Nay, sorrow is the greater.” But I say unto you, they are inseparable. Together they come, and when one sits alone with you at your board, remember that the other is asleep upon your bed." -- Kahlil Gibran

item.title: Arantza add a quote by Khalil Gibran
item.description: "Your joy is your sorrow unmasked. And the selfsame well from which your laughter rises was oftentimes filled with your tears. And how else can it be? The deeper that sorrow carves into your being, the more joy you can contain." -- Khalil Gibran

item.title: Arantza add a quote by Kahlil Gibran
item.description: "The Reality of The Other Person Lies Not In What He Reveals To You, But What He Cannot Reveal To You. Therefore, If You Would Understand Him, Listen Not To What He Says, But Rather To What He Does Not Say." -- Kahlil Gibran

item.title: Arantza add a quote by Kahil Gibran
item.description: "Generosity is giving more than you can, and pride is taking less than you need." -- Kahil Gibran

item.title: Arantza add a quote by Walt Whitman
item.description: "If you done it, it ain't bragging." -- Walt Whitman

item.title: Arantza add a quote by Pearl S. Buck
item.description: "The person who tries to live alone will not succeed as a human being. His heart withers if it does not answer another heart. His mind shrinks away if he hears only the echoes of his own thoughts and finds no other inspiration. " -- Pearl S. Buck

item.title: Arantza add a quote by Pearl S. Buck
item.description: "Many people lose the small joys in the hope for the big happiness." -- Pearl S. Buck

item.title: Arantza add a quote by Arthur Rimbaud
item.description: "But, truly, I have wept too much! The Dawns are heartbreaking. Every moon is atrocious and every sun bitter." -- Arthur Rimbaud

item.title: Arantza add a quote by Friedrich Wilhelm Nietzsche
item.description: "You have your way. I have my way. As for the right way, the correct way, and the only way, it does not exist." -- Friedrich Wilhelm Nietzsche

item.title: Arantza add a quote by Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
item.description: "Les hommes n'ont plus le temps de rien connaître. Ils achètent des choses toutes faites chez les marchands. Mais comme il n'existe point de marchands d'amis, les hommes n'ont plus d'amis." -- Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
